ai.summary: Amber Valley Routeway Walk 7 is a 13.7 km moderate hike in the UK along the Amber Valley Routeway, with rural scenery, mixed terrain, and several gentle ascents.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed rural terrain including canal towpaths, fields, woodland edges, and minor ascents. Expect some uneven ground and stiles; paths are generally well-defined but can be muddy after rain.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for 4–6 hours. Check weather before you go. Wear sturdy boots and bring waterproof clothing. Stay on official paths, watch for livestock and gates/stiles, and carry a map, compass or offline navigation on your phone. Bring enough water and snacks, and let someone know your route and expected return time. In the UK, dial 999 for emergencies.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Water bottle or hydration system (2–3 L)
Map and compass or GPS device with offline map
Headlamp or flashlight (in case of delays)
Lightweight emergency shelter or space blanket (optional)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) for milder weather and longer daylight; summer can be warmer, early autumn may have variable conditions.
